title: Calories in 6 oz Salmon
meta_description: Discover calories in 6 oz salmon, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Farmed Atlantic salmon, cooked (baked or grilled), skinless, no added oil, salt, or seasonings; 6 oz â‰ˆ 170 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type (wild vs. farmed), cut, cooking method, and portion size. Check labels or sources for exact values.

quick_answer.text: 6 oz cooked salmon offers ~350 kcal and ~37 g protein.

label_note: Totals are scaled from the per-100 g basis and mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil during cooking per 100 g
Wild salmon (vs. farmed) per 100 g, lower fat
Pan-fried with skin on per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 6 oz cooked salmon?
faqs.a: Approximately 350 kcal for 6 oz (170 g) cooked farmed salmon.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 6 oz salmon?
faqs.a: About 37 g of protein, making it a great lean source.

faqs.q: Does salmon have carbs or fiber?
faqs.a: Zero carbs and zero fiber per serving under these assumptions.

faqs.q: How does wild vs. farmed salmon differ in calories?
faqs.a: Wild salmon typically has fewer calories (~150-180 kcal/100 g) due to lower fat content.

faqs.q: Is 6 oz salmon a standard serving size?
faqs.a: Yes, it's a common portion; raw weight may yield slightly less after cooking.
